contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=April 2011}} <!-- Deleted image removed: [[File:Ministar vojislav vukcevic.jpg|thumb|''Vojislav Vukčević'']] --> '''Vojislav Vukčević''' ([[Serbian language|Serbian]] [[Cyrillic]]: '''Војислав Вукчевић'''; born 1938) was [[Serbia]]n Minister of the [[Serbian diaspora|Diaspora]].<ref name="McGarryKeating2006">{{cite book|last1=McGarry|first1=John|last2=Keating|first2=Michael|title=European integration and the nationalities question|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=lSukfE9folEC&pg=PA187|accessdate=22 April 2011|year=2006|publisher=Taylor & Francis|isbn=978-0-415-40100-5|pages=187–}}</ref> Vukčević was born in 1938 in [[Osijek]] in the [[Kingdom of Yugoslavia]] (today in [[Croatia]]), his father being from [[Montenegro]]. He graduated from the [[University of Belgrade]]'s [[University of Belgrade Faculty of Law|Law School]] and has received a doctoral degree from the [[University of Novi Sad]]'s [[Novi Sad Law School|Faculty of Law]], in 1974. He was a president of the court in [[Beli Manastir]], and worked as a dean and professor at the Faculty of Law, Osijek University, until the breakup of the [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia]]. Vukčević has been a secretary-general of the [[Serbian Renewal Movement]] since 1994. He was a deputy in the parliament and minister for relations with [[Serbs]] outside Serbia in the transitional government. He is married and has two children. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Vukcevic, Vojislav | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Serbian politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 1938 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Vukcevic, Vojislav}} [[Category:1938 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Osijek]] [[Category:Serbs of Croatia]] [[Category:Serbian Renewal Movement politicians]] [[Category:University of Novi Sad alumni]] [[Category:University of Belgrade Faculty of Law alumni]] {{Serbia-politician-stub}}
